All official communication will be via email through the Secretary.

questionListItems.title: Where do I find help for my PLD?

answer.body:
1. Proceed to ICTHelpdesk@sPace.

2. Inform ICT staff regarding the issues (e.g storage space, iPad disabled, apps)

3. ICT Staff will troubleshoot and give necessary advice.

  • if everything is working fine, the device will be returned.

  • Device may be wiped to restore functionality. (Device data may be lost, data backup is recommended)

  • Students to seek Service via the Service Centres or Asiapac Fortnightly Servicing*


*while waiting for the device to be serviced a temporary iPad will be loaned during this period

questionListItems.title: What should I do when I lost my PLD

answer.body:
Lost in school

  1. Trace back your steps to your last classroom/visited venue.

  1. Check with the General Office(GO), if anyone has passed them the any lost devices.

  1. Follow the Lost reporting procedure below.

Lost Reporting

  1. Inform the school ICT Helpdesk regarding the lost device*

  2. Report to police after effort has been made to look for the device.

  3. Inform the school ICT Helpdesk for subsequent action.

* ICT Staff can lock the iPad, provided that the device is on and connected to the wifi.

* ICT Helpdesk will provide a temporary iPad to use in the mean time.

questionListItems.title: My device was replaced and needs the DMA installed

answer.body:
Serviced via Apple Authorized Service Centre:

1. Bring the iPad back to sPace for the staff to note down the new serial number.*

2. ICT staff to check if the iPad is in MDM and proceed with necessary steps to ease the

login process into the school apps (gmail, google classroom, apple id)
* The helpdesk logs the device serial numbers to unassign them properly for when the student graduates or transfers out of the school. Failure to do so may cause devices to get stuck in DMA in the future.


Serviced via AsiaPac Fortnightly Servicing:

1. The iPad would already be installed with the necessary DMA. Helpdesk staff will contact students through email/Whatsapp to collect the iPad.

questionListItems.title: How do I replace a missing accessory?

answer.body: Parents can buy replacement accessories from Apple, AsiaPac or other retail shops.

questionListItems.title:
How long do I need to keep the device's original packaging before
discarding it?

answer.body: Please keep the device's original packaging for at least 7 days in case of defects and proceed to 1-to-1 exchange at the AsiaPac Service Centre.

questionListItems.title: What is considered as an Accidental damage?

answer.body: AppleCare defines accidental damages as damage from handling resulting from an unexpected and unintentional external event (such as, drops and damage caused by liquid contact). If it is found that the damages is caused by accidental damage, a service fee is required. This includes damages found during repair such as internal water damage.

questionListItems.title: My Apple pencil isn't working, how do I check if it is faulty?

answer.body:
Examine your iPad settings and the apple pencil condition:

1. If the Apple pencil is not able to write but can still be connected and charged. Change

the nib of the pencil with the spare nib that is given in the apple box.

2. If the Apple pencil is not able to charge or detected on ipad the ipad, use the the

adapter given in the apple box and connect it to the pencil and the ipad charger for 1-2mins. If it retains the charge, proceed to use as usual. However if it remains

undetectable, the device is considered faulty.

*Note: Even though this is an internal issue. Any physical damages found on the pencil may be

considered by the technicians as being caused by an accidental damage.
